017package org.apache.juneau.assertions;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.StringUtils.*;
020
021import java.io.*;
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.function.*;
024import java.util.regex.*;
025
026import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.serializer.*;
030
031/**
032 * Used for fluent assertion calls against strings.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
035 * <p class='bjava'>
036 *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
037 *    <jv>client</jv>
038 *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
039 *       .run()
040 *       .assertContent().is(<js>"OK"</js>);
041 * </p>
042 *
043 *
044 * <h5 class='section'>Test Methods:</h5>
045 * <p>
046 * <ul class='javatree'>
047 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentStringAssertion}
048 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
049 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#is(String) is(String)}
050 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNot(String) isNot(String)}
051 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isLines(String...) isLines(String...)}
052 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isSortedLines(String...) isSortedLines(String...)}
053 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isIc(String) isIc(String)}
054 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNotIc(String) isNotIc(String)}
055 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isContains(String...) isContains(String...)}
056 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNotContains(String...) isNotContains(String...)}
057 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isEmpty() isEmpty()}
058 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isNotEmpty() isNotEmpty()}
059 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isString(Object) isString(Object)}
060 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isMatches(String) isMatches(String)}
061 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isPattern(String) isPattern(String)}
062 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isPattern(String,int) isPattern(String,int)}
063 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isPattern(Pattern) isPattern(Pattern)}
064 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isStartsWith(String) isStartsWith(String)}
065 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#isEndsWith(String) isEndsWith(String)}
066 *    </ul>
067 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
068 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
069 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExists() isExists()}
070 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Object) is(Object)}
071 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#is(Predicate) is(Predicate)}
072 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNot(Object) isNot(Object)}
073 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isAny(Object...) isAny(Object...)}
074 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotAny(Object...) isNotAny(Object...)}
075 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNull() isNull()}
076 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isNotNull() isNotNull()}
077 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isString(String) isString(String)}
078 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isJson(String) isJson(String)}
079 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSame(Object) isSame(Object)}
080 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameJsonAs(Object) isSameJsonAs(Object)}
081 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSortedJsonAs(Object) isSameSortedJsonAs(Object)}
082 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer) isSameSerializedAs(Object, WriterSerializer)}
083 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isType(Class) isType(Class)}
084 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#isExactType(Class) isExactType(Class)}
085 *    </ul>
086 * </ul>
087 *
088 * <h5 class='section'>Transform Methods:</h5>
089 * <p>
090 * <ul class='javatree'>
091 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentStringAssertion}
092 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
093 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asReplaceAll(String,String) asReplaceAll(String,String)}
094 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asReplace(String,String) asReplace(String,String)}
095 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asUrlDecode() asUrlDecode()}
096 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asLc() asLc()}
097 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asUc() asUc()}
098 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asLines() asLines()}
099 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asSplit(String) asSplit(String)}
100 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asLength() asLength()}
101 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentStringAssertion#asOneLine() asOneLine()}
102  *   </ul>
103 *    <li class='jc'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion}
104 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
105 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString() asString()}
106 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(WriterSerializer) asString(WriterSerializer)}
107 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asString(Function) asString(Function)}
108 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJson() asJson()}
109 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asJsonSorted() asJsonSorted()}
110 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asTransformed(Function) asApplied(Function)}
111 *       <li class='jm'>{@link FluentObjectAssertion#asAny() asAny()}
112 * </ul>
113 * </ul>
114 *
115 * <h5 class='section'>Configuration Methods:</h5>
116 * <p>
117 * <ul class='javatree'>
118 *    <li class='jc'>{@link Assertion}
119 *    <ul class='javatreec'>
120 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setMsg(String, Object...) setMsg(String, Object...)}
121 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setOut(PrintStream) setOut(PrintStream)}
122 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setSilent() setSilent()}
123 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setStdOut() setStdOut()}
124 *       <li class='jm'>{@link Assertion#setThrowable(Class) setThrowable(Class)}
125 *    </ul>
126 * </ul>
127 *
128 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
129 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauEcosystemOverview">Juneau Ecosystem Overview</a>
130 * </ul>
131 *
132 * @param <R> The return type.
133 */
134@FluentSetters(returns="FluentStringAssertion<R>")
135public class FluentStringAssertion<R> extends FluentObjectAssertion<String,R> {
136
137   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
138   // Static
139   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
140
141   private static final Messages MESSAGES = Messages.of(FluentStringAssertion.class, "Messages");
142   private static final String
143      MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition = MESSAGES.getString("stringDifferedAtPosition"),
144      MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentNumbersOfLines = MESSAGES.getString("expectedStringHadDifferentNumbersOfLines"),
145      MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentValuesAtLine = MESSAGES.getString("expectedStringHadDifferentValuesAtLine"),
146      MSG_stringEqualedUnexpected = MESSAGES.getString("stringEqualedUnexpected"),
147      MSG_stringDidNotContainExpectedSubstring = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotContainExpectedSubstring"),
148      MSG_stringContainedUnexpectedSubstring = MESSAGES.getString("stringContainedUnexpectedSubstring"),
149      MSG_stringWasNotEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("stringWasNotEmpty"),
150      MSG_stringWasNull = MESSAGES.getString("stringWasNull"),
151      MSG_stringWasEmpty = MESSAGES.getString("stringWasEmpty"),
152      MSG_stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern"),
153      MSG_stringDidNotStartWithExpected = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotStartWithExpected"),
154      MSG_stringDidNotEndWithExpected = MESSAGES.getString("stringDidNotEndWithExpected");
155
156   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
157   // Instance
158   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
159
160   private boolean javaStrings;
161
162   /**
163    * Constructor.
164    *
165    * @param value
166    *    The object being tested.
167    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
168    * @param returns
169    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
170    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
171    * used on the same assertion.
172    */
173   public FluentStringAssertion(String value, R returns) {
174      this(null, value, returns);
175   }
176
177   /**
178    * Chained constructor.
179    *
180    * <p>
181    * Used when transforming one assertion into another so that the assertion config can be used by the new assertion.
182    *
183    * @param creator
184    *    The assertion that created this assertion.
185    *    <br>Should be <jk>null</jk> if this is the top-level assertion.
186    * @param value
187    *    The object being tested.
188    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk>.
189    * @param returns
190    *    The object to return after a test method is called.
191    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, the test method returns this object allowing multiple test method calls to be
192    * used on the same assertion.
193    */
194   public FluentStringAssertion(Assertion creator, String value, R returns) {
195      super(creator, value, returns);
196   }
197
198   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
199   // Config methods
200   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
201
202   /**
203    * When enabled, text in the message is converted to valid Java strings.
204    *
205    * <p class='bjava'>
206    *    <jv>value</jv>.replaceAll(<js>"\\\\"</js>, <js>"\\\\\\\\"</js>).replaceAll(<js>"\n"</js>, <js>"\\\\n"</js>).replaceAll(<js>"\t"</js>, <js>"\\\\t"</js>);
207    * </p>
208    *
209    * @return This object.
210    */
211   @FluentSetter
212   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asJavaStrings() {
213      this.javaStrings = true;
214      return this;
215   }
216
217   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
218   // Transform methods
219   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
220
221   @Override /* FluentObjectAssertion */
222   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asTransformed(Function<String,String> function) {  // NOSONAR - Intentional.
223      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, function.apply(orElse(null)), returns());
224   }
225
226   /**
227    * Performs the specified regular expression replacement on the underlying string.
228    *
229    * @param regex The regular expression to which this string is to be matched.
230    * @param replacement The string to be substituted for each match.
231    * @return This object.
232    */
233   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asReplaceAll(String regex, String replacement) {
234      Utils.assertArgNotNull("regex", regex);
235      Utils.assertArgNotNull("replacement", replacement);
236      return asTransformed(x -> x == null ? null : x.replaceAll(regex, replacement));
237   }
238
239   /**
240    * Performs the specified substring replacement on the underlying string.
241    *
242    * @param target The sequence of char values to be replaced.
243    * @param replacement The replacement sequence of char values.
244    * @return This object.
245    */
246   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asReplace(String target, String replacement) {
247      Utils.assertArgNotNull("target", target);
248      Utils.assertArgNotNull("replacement", replacement);
249      return asTransformed(x -> x == null ? null : x.replace(target, replacement));
250   }
251
252   /**
253    * URL-decodes the text in this assertion.
254    *
255    * @return This object.
256    */
257   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asUrlDecode() {
258      return asTransformed(StringUtils::urlDecode);
259   }
260
261   /**
262    * Converts the text to lowercase.
263    *
264    * @return This object.
265    */
266   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asLc() {
267      return asTransformed(x->x == null ? null : x.toLowerCase());
268   }
269
270   /**
271    * Converts the text to uppercase.
272    *
273    * @return This object.
274    */
275   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asUc() {
276      return asTransformed(x->x == null ? null : x.toUpperCase());
277   }
278
279   /**
280    * Splits the string into lines.
281    *
282    * @return This object.
283    */
284   public FluentListAssertion<String,R> asLines() {
285      return asSplit("[\r\n]+");
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Splits the string into lines using the specified regular expression.
290    *
291    * @param regex The delimiting regular expression
292    * @return This object.
293    */
294   public FluentListAssertion<String,R> asSplit(String regex) {
295      Utils.assertArgNotNull("regex", regex);
296      return new FluentListAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : Arrays.asList(value().trim().split(regex)), returns());
297   }
298
299   /**
300    * Returns the length of this string as an integer assertion.
301    *
302    * @return This object.
303    */
304   public FluentIntegerAssertion<R> asLength() {
305      return new FluentIntegerAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().length(), returns());
306   }
307
308   /**
309    * Removes any newlines from the string.
310    *
311    * @return This object.
312    */
313   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asOneLine() {
314      return asTransformed(x->x == null ? null : x.replaceAll("\\s*[\r\n]+\\s*","  "));
315   }
316
317   /**
318    * Removes any leading/trailing whitespace from the string.
319    *
320    * @return This object.
321    */
322   public FluentStringAssertion<R> asTrimmed() {
323      return new FluentStringAssertion<>(this, valueIsNull() ? null : value().trim(), returns());
324   }
325
326   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
327   // Test methods
328   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
329
330   /**
331    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value.
332    *
333    * <p>
334    * Similar to {@link #is(String)} except error message states diff position.
335    *
336    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
337    * <p class='bjava'>
338    *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
339    *    <jv>client</jv>
340    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
341    *       .run()
342    *       .assertContent().is(<js>"OK"</js>);
343    * </p>
344    *
345    * @param value
346    *    The value to check against.
347    *    <br>If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
348    * @return The fluent return object.
349    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
350    */
351   @Override
352   public R is(String value) throws AssertionError {
353      var s = orElse(null);
354      if (Utils.ne(value, s))
355         throw error(MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition, diffPosition(value, s), fix(value), fix(s));
356      return returns();
357   }
358
359   /**
360    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value.
361    *
362    * @param value The value to check against.
363    * @return The fluent return object.
364    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
365    */
366   @Override
367   public R isNot(String value) throws AssertionError {
368      var s = orElse(null);
369      if (Utils.eq(value, s))
370         throw error(MSG_stringEqualedUnexpected, fix(s));
371      return returns();
372   }
373
374   /**
375    * Asserts that the lines of text equals the specified value.
376    *
377    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
378    * <p class='bjava'>
379    *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
380    *    <jv>client</jv>
381    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
382    *       .run()
383    *       .assertContent().isLines(
384    *          <js>"Line 1"</js>,
385    *          <js>"Line 2"</js>,
386    *          <js>"Line 3"</js>
387    *       );
388    * </p>
389    *
390    * @param lines
391    *    The value to check against.
392    *    <br>If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
393    * @return The fluent return object.
394    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
395    */
396   public R isLines(String...lines) throws AssertionError {
397      Utils.assertArgNotNull("lines", lines);
398      var v = Utils.join(lines, '\n');
399      var s = value();
400      if (Utils.ne(v, s))
401         throw error(MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition, diffPosition(v, s), fix(v), fix(s));
402      return returns();
403   }
404
405   /**
406    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value after splitting both by newlines and sorting the rows.
407    *
408    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
409    * <p class='bjava'>
410    *    <jc>// Validates the response body of an HTTP call is the text "OK".</jc>
411    *    <jv>client</jv>
412    *       .get(<jsf>URL</jsf>)
413    *       .run()
414    *       .assertContent().isSortedLines(
415    *          <js>"Line 1"</js>,
416    *          <js>"Line 2"</js>,
417    *          <js>"Line 3"</js>
418    *       );
419    * </p>
420    *
421    * @param lines
422    *    The value to check against.
423    *    <br>If multiple values are specified, they are concatenated with newlines.
424    * @return The fluent return object.
425    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
426    */
427   public R isSortedLines(String...lines) {
428      Utils.assertArgNotNull("lines", lines);
429
430      // Must work for windows too.
431      var e = Utils.join(lines, '\n').trim().split("[\r\n]+");
432      var a = value().trim().split("[\r\n]+");
433
434      if (e.length != a.length)
435         throw error(MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentNumbersOfLines, e.length, a.length);
436
437      Arrays.sort(e);
438      Arrays.sort(a);
439
440      for (var i = 0; i < e.length; i++)
441         if (! e[i].equals(a[i]))
442            throw error(MSG_expectedStringHadDifferentValuesAtLine, i+1, e[i], a[i]);
443
444      return returns();
445   }
446
447   /**
448    * Asserts that the text equals the specified value ignoring case.
449    *
450    * @param value The value to check against.
451    * @return The fluent return object.
452    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
453    */
454   public R isIc(String value) throws AssertionError {
455      var s = orElse(null);
456      if (Utils.neic(value, s))
457         throw error(MSG_stringDifferedAtPosition, diffPositionIc(value, s), fix(value), fix(s));
458      return returns();
459   }
460
461   /**
462    * Asserts that the text does not equal the specified value ignoring case.
463    *
464    * @param value The value to check against.
465    * @return The fluent return object.
466    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
467    */
468   public R isNotIc(String value) throws AssertionError {
469      var s = orElse(null);
470      if (Utils.eqic(value, s))
471         throw error(MSG_stringEqualedUnexpected, fix(s));
472      return returns();
473   }
474
475   /**
476    * Asserts that the text contains all of the specified substrings.
477    *
478    * @param values The values to check against.
479    * @return The fluent return object.
480    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
481    */
482   public R isContains(String...values) throws AssertionError {
483      Utils.assertArgNotNull("values", values);
484      var s = orElse(null);
485      for (var substring : values)
486         if (substring != null && ! StringUtils.contains(s, substring))
487            throw error(MSG_stringDidNotContainExpectedSubstring, fix(substring), fix(s));
488      return returns();
489   }
490
491   /**
492    * Asserts that the text doesn't contain any of the specified substrings.
493    *
494    * @param values The values to check against.
495    * @return The fluent return object.
496    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
497    */
498   public R isNotContains(String...values) throws AssertionError {
499      Utils.assertArgNotNull("values", values);
500      var s = orElse(null);
501      for (var substring : values)
502         if (substring != null && StringUtils.contains(s, substring))
503            throw error(MSG_stringContainedUnexpectedSubstring, fix(substring), fix(s));
504      return returns();
505   }
506
507   /**
508    * Asserts that the text is empty.
509    *
510    * @return The fluent return object.
511    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
512    */
513   public R isEmpty() throws AssertionError {
514      var s = orElse(null);
515      if (s != null && ! s.isEmpty())
516         throw error(MSG_stringWasNotEmpty, fix(s));
517      return returns();
518   }
519
520   /**
521    * Asserts that the text is not null or empty.
522    *
523    * @return The fluent return object.
524    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
525    */
526   public R isNotEmpty() throws AssertionError {
527      var s = orElse(null);
528      if (s == null)
529         throw error(MSG_stringWasNull);
530      if (s.isEmpty())
531         throw error(MSG_stringWasEmpty);
532      return returns();
533   }
534
535   /**
536    * Asserts that the text matches the specified pattern containing <js>"*"</js> meta characters.
537    *
538    * <p>
539    * The <js>"*"</js> meta character can be used to represent zero or more characters..
540    *
541    * @param searchPattern The search pattern.
542    * @return The fluent return object.
543    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
544    */
545   public R isMatches(String searchPattern) throws AssertionError {
546      Utils.assertArgNotNull("searchPattern", searchPattern);
547      return isPattern(Utils.getMatchPattern3(searchPattern));
548   }
549
550   /**
551    * Asserts that the text matches the specified regular expression.
552    *
553    * @param regex The pattern to test for.
554    * @return The fluent return object.
555    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
556    */
557   public R isPattern(String regex) throws AssertionError {
558      return isPattern(regex, 0);
559   }
560
561   /**
562    * Asserts that the text matches the specified regular expression.
563    *
564    * @param regex The pattern to test for.
565    * @param flags Pattern match flags.  See {@link Pattern#compile(String, int)}.
566    * @return The fluent return object.
567    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
568    */
569   public R isPattern(String regex, int flags) throws AssertionError {
570      Utils.assertArgNotNull("regex", regex);
571      var p = Pattern.compile(regex, flags);
572      var s = value();
573      if (! p.matcher(s).matches())
574         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern, fix(regex), fix(s));
575      return returns();
576   }
577
578   /**
579    * Asserts that the text matches the specified regular expression pattern.
580    *
581    * @param pattern The pattern to test for.
582    * @return The fluent return object.
583    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
584    */
585   public R isPattern(Pattern pattern) throws AssertionError {
586      Utils.assertArgNotNull("pattern", pattern);
587      var s = value();
588      if (! pattern.matcher(s).matches())
589         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotMatchExpectedPattern, fix(pattern.pattern()), fix(s));
590      return returns();
591   }
592
593   /**
594    * Asserts that the text starts with the specified string.
595    *
596    * @param string The string to test for.
597    * @return The fluent return object.
598    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
599    */
600   public R isStartsWith(String string) {
601      Utils.assertArgNotNull("string", string);
602      var s = value();
603      if (! s.startsWith(string))
604         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotStartWithExpected, fix(string), fix(s));
605      return returns();
606   }
607
608   /**
609    * Asserts that the text ends with the specified string.
610    *
611    * @param string The string to test for.
612    * @return The fluent return object.
613    * @throws AssertionError If assertion failed.
614    */
615   public R isEndsWith(String string) {
616      Utils.assertArgNotNull("string", string);
617      var s = value();
618      if (! s.endsWith(string))
619         throw error(MSG_stringDidNotEndWithExpected, fix(string), fix(s));
620      return returns();
621   }
622
623   /**
624    * Asserts that the text equals the specified object after calling {@link #toString()} on the object.
625    *
626    * @param value The value to check against.
627    * @return The fluent return object.
628    */
629   public R isString(Object value) {
630      return is(value == null ? null : toString());
631   }
632
633   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
634   // Fluent setters
635   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
636
637   // <FluentSetters>
638
639   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
640   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setMsg(String msg, Object...args) {
641      super.setMsg(msg, args);
642      return this;
643   }
644
645   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
646   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setOut(PrintStream value) {
647      super.setOut(value);
648      return this;
649   }
650
651   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
652   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setSilent() {
653      super.setSilent();
654      return this;
655   }
656
657   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
658   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setStdOut() {
659      super.setStdOut();
660      return this;
661   }
662
663   @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.assertions.Assertion */
664   public FluentStringAssertion<R> setThrowable(Class<? extends java.lang.RuntimeException> value) {
665      super.setThrowable(value);
666      return this;
667   }
668
669   // </FluentSetters>
670
671   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
672   // Utility methods
673   //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
674
675   private String fix(String text) {
676      if (javaStrings)
677         text = text.replace("\\", "\\\\").replace("\n", "\\n").replace("\t", "\\t");
678      return text;
679   }
680}
